Method: Carbon Credits (Carbon Farming Initiative) (Reduction of Greenhouse Gas Emissions through Early Dry Season Savanna Burning - 1.1) Methodology Determination 2013
Project Description: This project involves the strategic and planned burning of savanna areas during the early dry season to reduce the risk of late dry season wild fires.
Project Area(s), where the project is an:
2480/SP254320, 2457/SP254322, 2322/SP254319, 2485/SP254321



This project is in the Carpentaria local government area.
Notes:
This project was registered subject to the condition mentioned in section 28A(2) of the CFI Act (written consent of relevant interest holders). The condition was removed on 06/05/16, and the project was issued 34,274 ACCUs on 01/07/16. The condition was reinstated on 27/10/2016

1/12/2017 Relinquishment of Australian carbon credit units - the Clean Energy Regulator issued a notice under section 88 of the CFI Act requiring Country Carbon Pty Ltd to relinquish 34,274 Australian carbon credit units.

8/01/2018 The Clean Energy Regulator received an application from Country Carbon Pty Ltd under section 241 of the CFI Act for reconsideration of the notice issued under section 88 requiring relinquishment of 34,274 Australian carbon credit units.

19/02/2018 This project has been revoked under section 32 of the CFI Rule.

27/03/2018 The Clean Energy Regulator issued a notice under section 242 of the CFI Act to Country Carbon Pty Ltd affirming the decision to require relinquishment of 34,274 Australian carbon credit units.

20/04/2018 Country Carbon Pty Ltd applied to the Administrative Appeals Tribunal (AAT) to review the Clean Energy Regulator's decision to require relinquishment of 34,274 Australian carbon credit units.

24/07/2019 Country Carbon Pty Ltd withdrew its AAT application.

13/8/2019 Country Carbon Pty Ltd relinquished 34,274 ACCUs to meet the relinquishment requirement.
